intro: Tristaniopsis whiteana subsp. monostemon, commonly known as the monostemon tristaniopsis, is a rare and unique member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive floral structure, featuring a single stamen, which is a notable botanical trait. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in lowland rainforests. Its leaves are usually alternate and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and specialized ecological requirements.
